ideas.title: Waymo suspends service in San Francisco as robotaxis stall during blackout
ideas.description: Waymo suspended its SF robotaxi service on Saturday evening after a massive blackout appeared to leave many of its vehicles stalled on city streets.

ideas.title: The coming AI security crisis (and what to do about it) | Sander Schulhoff
ideas.description: AI guardrails don't work. Security researcher Sander Schulhoff on prompt injection, red teaming, why AI defenses fail, and what actually secures AI products.
hooks: AI Security: 5 Shocking Ways Your System Is Vulnerable
Hackers' Secret Playbook: Breaking AI Guardrails Exposed
Why Your AI Is One Prompt Away From Disaster

ideas.title: Hiring specialists made sense before AI â€” now generalists win
ideas.description: Tony Stoyanov is CTO and co-founder of EliseAIIn the 2010s, tech companies chased staff-level specialists: Backend engineers, data scientists, system architects. That model worked when technology evolved slowly. Specialists knew their craft, could deliver quickly and built careers on predictable foundations like cloud infrastructure or the latest JS frameworkThen AI went mainstream.The pace of change has exploded. New technologies appear and mature in less than a year. You canâ€™t hire someone who
hooks: AI Changes Everything: Specialists Are Yesterday's News

Why Versatility Trumps Specialization in the AI Era

ideas.title: New York Governor Kathy Hochul signs RAISE Act to regulate AI safety
ideas.description: The bill will require large AI developers to publish information about their safety protocols and report safety incidents to the state within 72 hours.
hooks: AI Safety Law: New York's Bold Regulatory Move
Hochul's RAISE Act: Transforming AI Governance
72 Hours to Report: AI's New Legal Landscape
